labels.text:
‘Chinese rickshaw drivers and local residents rush two people to the hospital wounded during the government crackdown on the students in Tiananmen Square.’

The accompanying description is courtesy of Liu Heung Shing’s monograph, China After Mao, first published in 1983.

‘Liu Heung Shing is a photojournalist who, after completing his studies in the United States, was posted to China as one of the first foreign correspondants to gain accreditation following the normalization of diplomatic relations between China and the U.S. Arriving in 1978, Liu Heung Shing began to document the changes engendered by the reform policy, a project he continued through to the end of the twentieth century. His renowned photographs captured many major historical events including the activities of the Stars Painting Group, and the Tiananman Square incident of 1989.’
Rickshaw drivers and local residents rush two injured people to the hospital during the government crackdown on the students in Tiananmen Square.

「天安門廣場被政府清場後，三輪車伕和北京市民合力把兩名受傷學生送往醫院。」

以上文字敘述出自劉香成著作《毛以後的中國》，首版1983年。

「劉香成，紀實攝影師，在美國畢業之後被派駐中國，是中美關係正常化之後首批被委派至中國的外國記者。 1978年到北京之後，劉香成開始紀錄改革開放帶來的變化，直至20世紀末。他著名的照片捕捉了很多重要的歷史事件，包括『星星畫會』運動、1989年『天安門事件』。」
天安門廣場被政府清場後，三輪車伕和北京市民合力把兩名受傷學生送往醫院。

title.en: 1989 Beijing, Sent Wounded Students on Tian'anmen Square to Hospital
title.zh-hant: 1989年北京， 送受傷的學生去醫院。

dimension.en:
frame: 83.7 × 103.3 cm
sheet: 78.6 × 98.3 cm
image (sight): 58.3 × 89 cm

inscription.en:
inscribed and dated LL in wax pencil: Injured, 1989
numbered LC in wax pencil: 6/8

images.AltText: Photograph of two men in bloodstained shirts being transported on the back of an open cargo bicycle. Two running men flank the cargo platform while several others look on.
images.AltTextTC: 照片中兩個衣衫濺血的男人，躺於三輪車後的貨板上，被運送至目的地。兩個男人分別在三輪車兩旁奔跑護送，另有幾個人從旁觀看。
